55783B1C2CE24F01AD5D730564AB237E.description:
Compare and contrast the process, design, and performance of numerous next-generation
energy sources (hydropower, wind power, solar power, geothermal power, biomass power,
etc.).¬†

5F79FE7E54C84936BF83257CFD1B2B2A.description:
Recognize and communicate information about energy efficiency and/or inefficiency of
machines used in everyday life.

CE42514B986D47F9B48ED2547BE7382C.description:
Define power and solve problems involving the rate of energy production or consumption (P =
ŒîE/Œît). Explain and predict changes in power consumption based on changes in energy demand
or elapsed time. Investigate power consumption and power production systems in common use.

995A69CF06EB40F8B0618FA63BA5E511.description:
Construct an argument based on qualitative and quantitative evidence that relates the change in
temperature of a substance to its mass and heat energy added or removed from a system.¬†

46267816BB474E29AEDE5DABC2EF6355.description:
Assess the validity of the law of conservation of linear momentum (p=mv) by planning and
constructing a controlled scientific investigation involving two objects moving in one-dimension.

28F49CFD9D5248118727F6E58205C9A3.description:
Use the principle of energy conservation and mathematical representations to quantify the
change in energy of one component of a system when the energy that flows in and out of the
system and the change in energy of the other components is known.¬†

DE3FD3B4978346EF94467006CAFDA454.description:
Investigate conduction, convection, and radiation as a mechanism for the transfer of thermal
energy.

3C84AF7C309748F4B6775B6CFEE82F17.description:
Plan and conduct an investigation to provide evidence that a constant force perpendicular to an
object's motion is required for uniform circular motion (F = m v2 / r).

920DAFBB36D34A20A304E5021FBB499D.description:
Develop a model to predict the range of a two-dimensional projectile based upon its starting
height, initial velocity, and angle at which it was launched.

55625B48336A443D964E9E31FE34029B.description:
Use experimental evidence to demonstrate that air resistance is a velocity dependent drag force
that leads to terminal velocity.

5555B36D40BA451BAE1FBF3F780CBCDC.description:
Develop and apply the impulse-momentum theorem along with scientific and engineering ideas
to design, evaluate, and refine a device that minimizes the force on an object during a collision
(e.g., helmet, seatbelt, parachute).¬†

, to calculate the gravitational forces,
mass, or distance separating two objects with mass, given the information about the other
quantities.

4AC5CB2D652A4E90AF8B5F0A493942DD.description:
Use examples of forces between pairs of objects involving gravitation, electrostatic, friction, and
normal forces to explain Newton's third law.

FE618663D4A04576B6562A611B7CAD1A.description:
Plan, conduct, and analyze the results of a controlled investigation to explore the validity of
Newton's second law of motion in a system subject to a net unbalanced force, Fnet = ma or Fnet
= Œîp/Œît.

2182789A2EBE409FBB99A96A0BC4268C.description:
Using experimental evidence and investigations, determine that Newton‚Äôs second law of motion
defines force as a change in momentum, F = Œîp/Œît.¬†

7FD7794D868F44C88AC98E36EA9B1FDF.description:
Gather evidence to defend the claim of Newton's first law of motion by explaining the effect
that balanced forces have upon objects that are stationary or are moving at constant velocity.¬†

E4F5E3BEB5E84F68B7A1AED2634FBF29.description:
Use free-body diagrams to illustrate the contact and non-contact forces acting on an object. Use
the diagrams in combination with graphical or component-based vector analysis and with
Newton's first and second laws to predict the position of the object on which the forces act in a
constant net force scenario.

D79A6AF2777E44A7B8973F81798B6C49.description:
Algebraically solve problems involving arc length, angular velocity, and angular acceleration.
Relate quantities to tangential magnitudes of translational motion.

5DEE3266F2514D51B83C77636CF22B8C.description: Algebraically solve problems involving constant velocity and constant acceleration in one dimension.

F411B760CE2649FF944152944BC14190.description:
Investigate and evaluate the graphical and mathematical relationship (using either manual
graphing or computers) of one-dimensional kinematic parameters (distance, displacement,
speed, velocity, acceleration) with respect to an object's position, direction of motion, and time.¬†

DF6C04F41D124477B51B9C381A8A87B0.description: Motion and Stability: Forces and Interactions
